item.title: By: Stephen
item.dc:creator: Stephen
item.description: Hi - this behaviour is due to Firefox 1.5+'s bfcache, as you found out. New events were introduced to be able to deal with the kinds of problems you found. Check out this page http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Using_Firefox_1.5_caching Essentially you need to do window.addEventListener("pageshow", someFunction)
item.content:encoded:
Hi – this behaviour is due to Firefox 1.5+’s bfcache, as you found out.
New events were introduced to be able to deal with the kinds of problems you found.
Check out this page http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/Using_Firefox_1.5_caching
Essentially you need to do window.addEventListener(“pageshow”, someFunction)
